The little-known masterpiece of Macedonian literature written by the Yugoslavian writer Zhivko Chingo in 1971. The popular movie 'The Great Water' was filmed by motives of this book in 2004.

The book is much less politicized than the film and much more optimistic and cheerful. We find a plenty of omitted details about our little heroes who were surviving after the Second World War in an Yugoslavian communist orphanage. We find also what really had happened to the mutilated 13 y.o. boy Isaac who was accused by state security officers that he abused a bust of Stalin and was thrown into the cellar to die. The little magician-molfar does not vanish, his life is going on, he has many other adventures and pranks ahead and the novel reaches so much powerful, emotional and bright culmination which would have been envied even by Shakespeare.

The theme of maternal love and the need of each person in his mother's love makes the book eternal and in our days.

Extended edition. Unabridged Macedonian text according to the 1st and the 2nd editions. English and Russian translations. Plus a lot of additional materials.
